bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to George A. Kellogg, March 17, 1942

div1.p: Hench thanks Kellogg for the information on the Cornwell painting unveiling in Cuba, which Hench hopes to attend.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to George A. Kellogg, March 17, 1942
div1.p:
I thought you might like to see the enclosed
item. I don't know whether it is the same as I sent
you before or not.

Thank you for the information regarding the
meeting in Havana. My vacation plans are very uncertain.
I suspect that I will try to hold out a week anyhow and
not take my whole vacation in the hope that the Havana
affair may go through, as I should very much like to go
if the meeting is held.

I will not send Dr. Hoffman any reprints,
assuming that you have taken care of the matter. Thank
you kindly for the five reproductions of the Cuban versions.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. Mr. George A. Kellogg
257 Cornelison Avenue
Jersey City, N. J.
